channel.title: Hideaki Hata | NAIST
channel.description: Recent content on Hideaki Hata | NAIST

item.title: Abstract
item.description: I am an Assistant Professor in Graduate School of Information Science at Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Japan. I am a member of Software Engineering Laboratory. I received M.Sc. Ph.D degrees in Graduate School of Information Science and Technology from Osaka University.

item.title: Recent papers
item.description: Nuttapon Lertwittayatrai, Raula Gaikovina Kula, Saya Onoue, Hideaki Hata, Arnon Rungsawang, Pattara Leelaprute, and Kenichi Matsumoto, Extracting Insights from the Topology of the Javascript Package Ecosystem, In Proc. of 24th Asia-Pacific Software Engineering Conference (APSEC2017). See [Figure]. Koji Kitagawa, Mingyu Guo, Kiminao Kogiso, and Hideaki Hata, Utility Design for Two-Player Normal-Form Games, In Proc. of 2017 Asian Control Conference (ASCC 2017). Hideaki Hata, Mingyu Guo, and Ali Babar, Understanding the Heterogeneity of Contributors in Bug Bounty Programs, In Proc.

item.title: Activities

item.title: Publications
item.description: Conference Proceedings Keitaro Nakasai, Hideaki Hata, Saya Onoue, and Kenichi Matsumoto, Analysis of Donations in Eclipse Project, In Proc. of 8th IEEE International Workshop on Empirical Software Engineering in Practice (IWESEP 2017), pp. 18-22, March 2017. Tetsuya Kanda, Mingyu Guo, Hideaki Hata, and Kenichi Matsumoto, Towards Understanding an Open-Source Bounty: Analysis of Bountysource, In Proc. of 24th IEEE International Conference on Software Analysis, Evolution, and Reengineering (SANER 2017), pp.
